channel.title: BUG: Unforeseen Consequences, No 'Tipped-Over' Mainframe
channel.description:
In [b]Unforeseen Consequences[/b], after crawling through a duct into a mainframe computer room, according to a walkthrough ([i]and playing the original Half-Life[/i]) there is suppose to be a "[i][b]tipped-over mainframe[/b][/i]" you use to climb through a hole into the next section.
[b]BM-BUG:[/b] The first time I got to the area and took care of the enemies, there was NO mainframe below the hole in the wall you need to climb thorough :brow:
Reloaded the save before I entered the duct.
This time, when I got to the wall with the hole, there WERE 2 mainframes BUT they were NOT tipped-over AND they disappeared when I approached :rage:

item.title: BUG: Unforeseen Consequences, No 'Tipped-Over' Mainframe
item.dc:creator: tecknode
item.description:
Tuskin38:

you talking about the room where you get the crowbar? You don’t need to jump on the mainframe in BM to get through.

OH? Then what do you do to get through the hole in the wall :what:

Read full topic

item.description:
In Unforeseen Consequences, after crawling through a duct into a mainframe computer room, according to a walkthrough (and playing the original Half-Life) there is suppose to be a “tipped-over mainframe” you use to climb through a hole into the next section.

BM-BUG: The first time I got to the area and took care of the enemies, there was NO mainframe below the hole in the wall you need to climb thorough :brow:

Reloaded the save before I entered the duct.

This time, when I got to the wall with the hole, there WERE 2 mainframes BUT they were NOT tipped-over AND they disappeared when I approached
